result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendall S Acoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
* March 2, 2021/Judge Danielle Shelton: Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect that the imposed and stayed sentence on count one is 18 months of initial confinement and 24 months of extended supervision. All other sentencing orders shall remain in effect.*
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay DNA surcharge and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the DOC's from 25% of prison funds and to convert to a civil judgment upon release from extended supervision or successfull completion of probation.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- No illegal drugs.
- No contact with drug community.
- Random urine screens.
- Seek/maintain full time employment, unless in school.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
- Vocational/educational training.

timeConds.notes: STRAIGHT TIME for the 1st violation and to increase by 10 days STRAIGHT time for each subsequent violation.
No good time credit; Court STAYED sentence to be used as sanctions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendall S Acoff

Defendant Kendall S Acoff in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Kendall S Acoff in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 52 days time served.; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 28 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*No illegal drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment., unless in school
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 10 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation and to increase by 10 days STRAIGHT time for each subesequent violation.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*No illegal drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain  fulltime employment., unless in school
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay DNA SURCHARGE and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision or successful completion of probation.

Court informed defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed,
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
-Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
